scenes.title: Homepage Exploration
scenes.script: The user lands on the React homepage, learning about React's purpose and key features.

scenes.title: Learning Resources
scenes.script: The user explores the learning resources provided, clicking on the 'Learn' menu and checking out the quick start guide.

scenes.title: API Documentation
scenes.script: The user searches for specific API information, using the search function. They learn about the different APIs and navigate to the 'React' API page.

scenes.title: Community Engagement
scenes.script: The user checks out the community section, learning about contributions and translations.

scenes.title: Version History
scenes.script: The user navigates to the versions page to check the release history, learning about different versions.

coverage: This demo showcases the React website's homepage, learning resources, API documentation, community features, and version history. Users will learn about React's capabilities and interactions.
assumptions: Basic web navigation knowledge for clicking links and buttons.
Access to the internet to load the website.
risks: Website content or layout may change, making some steps obsolete.
Users may have slow internet connections, affecting page load times.

segments: Welcome to the React demo. Today, we'll explore the website's key features.
Here's the homepage, which introduces React's purpose. We can learn more about its capabilities.
Let's dive into the learning resources. The 'Learn' section offers a quick start guide, perfect for beginners.
The API documentation is comprehensive. We can search for specific APIs using the box here and explore them in depth.
React fosters an active community. You can contribute and stay updated via the Community section.
Lastly, checking out the latest React versions is easy. The Versions page displays the release history.
In just a few minutes, we've covered React's essential features. This website offers a seamless learning experience.
